noun.description: A pithy observation that contains a general truth, such as, “if it ain't broke, don't fix it.”
examples: the old aphorism “the child is father to the man”
the debate begins and ends at the level of aphorism, with commentators saying that something must be done

origin: Early 16th century: from French aphorisme or late Latin aphorismus, from Greek aphorismos definition, from aphorizein define.
